data.title: Royals: New wedding photo of Prince Corbinian released
data.meta_description: Corbinian, Prince of Bavaria and Princess Magdalena
data.text:
It was not until May of this year that Ludwig, Prince of Bavaria, 41, and his wife Sophie-Alexandra Evekink in the Theatinerkirche in the heart of Munich a fairy tale wedding come true. Last weekend, the House of Bavaria inspired with the next wedding: Corbinian, Prince of Bavaria tied the knot with his great love Princess Magdalena on the island of Rügen, the bride’s homeland. This was shown by beautiful pictures on the official Instagram account of the noble family.

Corbinian, Prince of Bavaria and Princess Magdalena say “yes” to each other

“The church wedding of Prince Corbinian and Princess Magdalena took place in the bride’s home on the island of Rügen.” With these words, the house of Bavaria announced the wedding of Corbinian and his Magdalena on Saturday evening, August 12, 2023. Accordingly, the bride wore “a silk crepe dress by the designer @hedwig.feldscher from Vienna”. It continued: “The Belgian lace veil is an heirloom passed down the maternal line of the bride’s family for seven generations. Its roots date back to 1840.”

Touching family celebration

Another touching gesture: “The flowers and arrangements come from the bride’s garden and were arranged by family and friends”. In another video, the bridal couple was seen beaming with joy as they left the chapel after the church wedding, while their loved ones cheered them on.

Corbinian and Magdalena say thank you with a new wedding photo

A few days after their wedding ceremony became public, the newlywed couple thanks them for the numerous congratulations. About a beautiful picture that shows Corbinian and Magdalena beaming in the middle of the lush green landscape on Rügen, it says: “The bridal couple would like to thank you very much for all the congratulations and blessings that you received for the wedding.” In addition, the wedding date is finally revealed: According to this, the Prince of Bavaria and the Princess said yes to each other last Saturday, August 12th.

Corbinian, Prince of Bavaria was born in 1996 and is the son of Gudila Countess von Plettenberg-Lenhausen and Prince Christoph of Bavaria and grandson of Prince Rasso of Bavaria, who died in 2011. His grandfather, in turn, was Crown Prince Rupprecht, the last heir to the throne before the abolition of the monarchy in Bavaria.

Sources used: instagram.com, haus-bayern.com
